title: Medical Definition of Yellow fever vaccination
author: Medical Editor Melissa Conrad Stöppler; MD
description: Read medical definition of Yellow fever vaccination
cleaned_text: Yellow fever vaccination: A live [attenuated](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=13398) (weakened) [viral](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=15037) vaccine for yellow fever. Yellow fever [vaccination](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=5925) is recommended for people traveling to or living [in](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3950) the tropical areas in the Americas and Africa where yellow fever occurs. Because [yellow fever vaccination](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=6055) is a live vaccine, it should not be given to infants or people with [immune](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3905)-system problems.
